eccoLocation.resp: This file prepared by Alec Bartman

sourceDesc.p: Search terms extracted from the following text(s):

bibl.author: Missing
bibl.title: The biographical magazine. Containing portraits & characters of eminent and ingenious persons, of every age & nation.
bibl.note: Capt. Clerke appears to have co-lead an expedition with Capt. James Cook, either Cook's first or second voyage

bibl.author: Burke, Aedanus
bibl.title: Considerations on the Society or Order of Cincinnati; lately instituted by the major-generals, brigadier-generals, and other officers of the American army. Proving that it creates a race of hereditary patricians, or nobility. Interspersed with remarks on its consequences t the freedom and happiness of the republic. Addressed to the people of South-Carolina, and their representatives. By Cassius. Supposed to be written by Aedanus Burke, Esquire, one of the chief justices of the state of South-Carolina.
bibl.note: Capt. Clerke is described as the co-captain of Cook's voyages between 1775 and 1780

bibl.author: Ellis, W.(William)
bibl.title: An authentic narrative of a voyage performed by Captain Cook and Captain Clerke, in His Majesty's ships resolution and discovery, during the years 1776, 1777, 1778, 1779, and 1780; in search of a North-West passage between the continents of Asia and America. Including a faithful account of all their discoveries, and the unfortunate death of Captain Cook. Illustrated with a chart and a variety of cuts. By W. Ellis, assistant surgeon to both vessels.
bibl.editor: J. Sewell, Cornhill and J. Debrett, Piccadilly
bibl.note: The consequences of Capt. Clerke's death are discussed.

bibl.author: Adams, Michael, Esq
bibl.title: The new royal geographical magazine; or, a modern, complete, authentic, and copious system of universal geography : containing a complete, ... history and description of all the several parts of the whole world; ... To which will be added, a new and easy guide to geography and astronomy, ...
bibl.note: Atooi is one of the islands visited by Capt. Cook during his voyages

bibl.author: Baldwyn, George Augustus
bibl.title: A new, royal, authentic, complete, and universal system of geography; or, A modern history and description of the whole world. Containing new, ...
bibl.note: Atooi is one of the islands visited by Capt. Cook during his voyages

bibl.author: Missing
bibl.title: The annual register, or a view of the history, politics, and literature, for the year 1773.
bibl.note: Capt. Cook ecountered the area of Terra del Fuego, at the southern tip of South America, while crossing into the Pacific Ocean
